title: Angular momentum - graph of torque vs time

content.question: The graph represents the net torque exerted on a disk as a function of time. The disk rotates about an axis through its center. At which of the following two times is the angular momentum of the disk the same?

choices.label: <math alttext="0 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="1 second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and <math alttext="3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and <math alttext="4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math> and <math alttext="4 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
